Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 02:49PM Boldelly wrote: I do not know much about breast cancer but when my daughter was diagnosed with lymphoma they said that it is never cancer until it is biopsied.  Whether or not that is true with all cancers I do not know.  I know it is hard waiting for results and just wating and watching as this has been what we have had to endure for the last year and a half with my daughter and the lymphoma.  It is enough to drive me to the brink, but I am getting better and now this with me happens and I just had a mammogram and ultrasound on Monday and I am wondering what is taking so long to let me know if it is something or nothing.  I guess I am a bit impatient.  Also another questions for you guys, do they use PET scans for breast cancer diagnosis?  What modalities do they use other than mammogram and ultrasound?
Posts.Title: MRI results teralutt0805 wishiwere
